title: Parents starved baby to death then moaned to hospital staff they were hungry
text:
David and Kassandra Krutina were sentenced to probation for starving their baby daughter to death, despite complaining to hospital staff that they were hungry during the infant’s final hours (Pictures: Cass County Sheriff’s Office)

A couple who starved their premature baby daughter to death then complained of being hungry have avoided jail.

David Krutina, 24, and wife Kassanda, 21, were ordered to complete five years probation and 80 hours community service at a court hearing Monday.

The pair, from Louisville in Nebraska, escaped a potential 23 year prison sentence over daughter Samantha’s September 2018 death after being allowed to strike a plea deal in August.

It came despite the couple showing shocking callousness and disregard for their baby as she lay dying.

The Krutinas ignored Samantha during her final hours at the Children’s Hospital in Omaha, despite being told she would not survive.

Samantha died at Omaha Children’s Hospital, pictured, last September (Picture: Google Maps)

They stayed on a different floor close to Samantha’s twin sister Charlotte, who had also been badly starved.

And the couple even began to complain that they wanted to go home as Samantha slipped away, because they were tired, hungry and needed to let their dogs out, KETV reported.

Samantha and Charlotte were born in February 2018 at 27 weeks , with Samantha weighing just two pounds three ounces at birth.

The babies spent two months in intensive care before being allowed home – but were rushed back to hospital last September suffering severe malnourishment.

Samantha died of a bacterial infection caused by malnourishment later that evening, with hospital staff calling the infant’s death ‘one of the worst cases of neglect they have encountered.’

It is unclear why the Krutinas were able to get off so lightly, with readers of a local newspaper among those appalled by the sentences handed out to the pair.

The Lincoln Journal-Star reported that the babies they’d only been taken to the doctor’s once, two days after being discharged from hospital.

The Krutinas have been allowed to continue to care for their older children.

Samantha’s sister Charlotte may also be returned to the pair, with a judge set to rule on custody at a later date.
description: David Krutina and his wife Kassandra avoided jail and were sentenced to probation despite letting daughter Samantha die of malnutrition
